title: DOMexception on OneDrive page
content:
Hi,

when I try to access the Gallery photos page on OneDrive, especially in the 'For you' section, I get a gray screen and nothing happens. When I check the console, it shows the issues I've captured in the screenshot. I tried this on Mac and Ubuntu with a fresh profile and a clear internet connection. Does anyone have an idea why this is happening? Firefox Version is the latest 142.0.1 No problem with Vivaldi, Chrome etc.

Thanks, Dirk
creator: info10269

title: esc disables full screen on Mac
content: I always use Full Screen mode on MacOS (^⌘F). However, when I press the escape key, it always leaves Full Screen mode. This is annoying when browsing: whenever there is a popup which you should be able to leave with pressing 'Esc', the browser goes out of Full Screen. Why does 'Esc' lead to leaving Full Screen, when there is a dedicated key command to do this (^⌘F)? At least there should be a option to change this behaviour.
creator: p.ahles

title: Add-On for Avast antiTrack Protection will not add in Firefox, Why?
content:
Current response is as follows:-

Oops! We can’t find that page

If you’ve followed a link from another site for an extension or theme, that item is no longer available. This could be because: 

   The developer removed it. Developers commonly do this because they no longer support the extension or theme, or have replaced it.    Mozilla removed it. This can happen when issues are found during the review of the extension or theme, or the extension or theme has been abusing the terms and conditions for addons.mozilla.org. The developer has the opportunity to resolve the issues and make the add-on available again.

Try visiting the page later, as the theme or extension may become available again. Alternatively, you may be able to find what you’re looking for in one of the available extensions or themes, or by asking for help on our community forums.

title: frodoangeles57078@gmail.com
content:
Last updated on: December 1, 2018        Guangdong OPPO Mobile Telecommunications Corp., Ltd. (registered at 18 Haibin Road, Wusha Community, Chang'an Town, Dongguan City) and its associated companies (hereinafter referred to as "OPPO", "We") are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy. Therefore, we have formulated this privacy policy, which covers how we collect, use, disclose, transmit, and store your personal information when you use our websites, mobile apps or services. Before using our products (or services) and submitting your personal information, please read this Privacy Policy carefully to learn how we handle our customers' privacy.        This policy is intended to help you understand the following: I Definition II How we use Cookies and similar technologies III How we collect and use your personal information IV How we keep your personal information V How your personal information may be disclosed VI How we protect your personal information VII Your rights with regards to your personal information VIII How we handle personal information of children IX Third-party service providers and their services X. How your personal information is transferred globally XI How this Privacy Policy is updated

I Definition        "Associated company" refers to a company related to OPPO by common ownership or control.        "Third party" refers to a company or person that is not associated with OPPO by common ownership or control, in other words, an unrelated company or individual. A third party can be a financial or non-financial company, or any person other than you or OPPO.        "Personal Information" refers to any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.

II How we use Cookies and similar technologies 1. What are Cookies?        Cookies are small files that are transferred from our websites, applications or services and stored on your device. OPPO’s websites, online services, interactive applications, emails, and advertisements may use Cookies and other similar technologies such as pixel tags and web beacons. Cookies may be stored on your computer for a short period of time (such as only while your browser is open) or for an extended period of time, even years. Cookies not set by us are not accessible to us. 2. Cookies we use (1) OPPO and its partners use Cookies or similar tracking technologies to better understand how you use the mobile software on your device, including how often you use the apps, the events that occur within the apps, cumulative usage and performance data of the apps, and from where you have downloaded the apps. We do not link the information stored within the analysis software to any personal information you may have submitted in the mobile apps. (2) OPPO and its partners use Cookies or similar tracking technologies to analyze trends, administer the websites, track user behaviors on the websites, and collect overall demographic information of our users' base. (3) Many web browsers have "Do Not Track" function. Such function can issue "Do Not Track" requests to websites. If "Do Not Track" is enabled on your browser, we will respect your choice with all of our websites. (4) As is true of most websites, we automatically gather certain information to analyze cumulative trends and administer our websites. Such information may include Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, files you viewed on our sites (e.g., HTML pages, graphics, etc.), operating system, date/time stamps, and/or clickstream data. (5) We work with third parties to display advertisements on our websites or to manage our advertisements on other websites. Our third-party partners may use Cookies or similar tracking technologies to provide advertisements to you based on your browsing activities and interests. If you want to opt out of receiving interest-based advertising, you can "Clear/Disable Cookies" (as described below) to manage Cookies and Cookie preferences. Please note that you will continue to receive general advertising that does not target any specific person when you visit the above websites. 3. Removing/disabling Cookies        Managing Cookies and Cookie preferences shall be done from within your browser's options/preferences. Here is a list of guides on how to do this for popular browsers:
